meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a fact.
meanings.sent1: The facticities of the situation were undeniable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on facticities to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The facticities of the case left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was a facticities that shone brightly among the lies.
meanings.sent5: The facticities of history cannot be changed.

meanings.definition: Facts or realities that exist independently of human perception or interpretation.
meanings.sent1: The facticities of nature are fascinating to study.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers debate the existence of such facticities.
meanings.sent3: The facticities of the ghost story made it even scarier.
meanings.sent4: The facticities of the universe are beyond our comprehension.
meanings.sent5: The facticities of science continue to amaze us.
